net.nexttext.property
Class Vector3Property

java.lang.Object
  net.nexttext.property.Property
      net.nexttext.property.Vector3Property
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class Vector3Property
extends Property

A vector3 property of a TextObject or a Behaviour.

Note that defensive copies of the current value and and original value of the properties are always created when getting or setting the property.

Also note that every wrapper method around Vector3 arithmetic operations will fire a property change event. Maybe we want to consider removing these wrappers to lower the event overhead.

See Also:
Vector3

Constructor Detail

Vector3Property

public Vector3Property(Vector3 value)
Constructor. Creates a new Vector3Property based on the object passed as a parameter. The current and original values for that property will both be a copy of the parameter value.

                       double y,
                       double z)

Vector3Property

public Vector3Property(double x,
                       double y)
Creates a Vector3 property from 2 doubles, using 0 as the z coordainte.

Vector3Property

public Vector3Property(Vector3 original,
                       Vector3 value)
Construct a property with specified original and future values.

The provided vectors are copied. This function is used for the special purpose of calculating an absolute position from the natively stored relative positions.

clone

public Vector3Property clone()
Description copied from class: Property
Get a new property with the same values as this one.

The name is copied because that's what makes it a Property and not just a value.

PropertyChangeListeners are not copied to the new Property.

Overrides:
clone in class Property
